subject: RE: [junit] test with in
msgSnippet: Hi Create a simple ANT task which uses BSF and introspection to execute this code. -S ... From: rootsonwings [mailto:rootsonwings@yahoo.com] Sent: Tuesday, May
messageBody:
Hi

Create a simple ANT task which uses BSF and introspection to execute this code.


-S

-----Original Message-----
From: rootsonwings [mailto:rootsonwings@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 2004 3:02 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] test with in

hello !
some one consider this

public class Adder{

public int add(int a , int b){
       return a + b;
    }

/*
<test>
   <method name= "public int add(int a ,int b)">
   ... test codes
   </method>
</test>
*/
}
how about this where we have same file for the logic as well as the
test for it and when it is build let say using ANT we have option for
excluding the test codes or test it .
is it possible ?
